multiROC | R package
  • Functions
  • Tutorials and examples
    • Introduction to `multiROC`

[!] Carry out ROC analysis for each feature in pairs of groups

For spectroscopic data: compare spectra of each pair of indicated groups at each wavelength.

print.roc_performance(x, ..., digits = 2, cutoff_fmt = "%.4g")

roc_multi_analysis(x, gr = NULL, optimize_by = "bac", ...)

# S3 method for matrix
roc_multi_analysis(x, gr = NULL, optimize_by = "bac", ...,
  gr_sep = " vs. ")

# S3 method for numeric
roc_multi_analysis(x, gr = NULL, optimize_by = "bac", ...)

# S3 method for data.frame
roc_multi_analysis(x, gr = NULL, optimize_by = "bac",
  ...)

# S3 method for hyperSpec
roc_multi_analysis(x, gr = NULL, optimize_by = "bac",
  ...)

Arguments

x

roc_performance object for method print.
...

Arguments passed for further methods.
digits

(integer(1)) A number of decimals to display for performance measures. Default is 2.
cutoff_fmt

(character(1)) A string with a number display format for cut-off values. Will be passed to sprintf. Default is "%.4g".
gr

Either a string (scalar, character(1)) or a factor variable (a vector) which defines groups in x.
optimize_by

(string(1)) A string with the name of classification performance measure to use. Currently available options:

  • "bac" - for balanced accuracy (mean of sensitivity and specificity);

  • "kappa" - for Cohens kappa;

  • "youden" - for Youden's index;
gr_sep

Group separator used to paste the names of groups. Default is " vs. ".
x

A numeric matrix, a data frame, a hyperSpec object or another type of object, convertible to a numeric matrix.

Value

Object of classes roc_performance and data.frame with columns:#'

  • compared_groups Names of compared groups separated by gr_sep (default value is " vs. ");

  • feature names of compared features;

  • cutoff for optimal threshold/cut-off values and corresponding performance measures;

  • TP number of true positives;

  • FN number of false negatives;

  • FP number of false positives;

  • TN number of true negatives;

  • sens sensitivity (true positive rate, recall);

  • spec specificity (true negative rate);

  • PPV positive predictive value (precision);

  • NPV negative predictive value;

  • BAC balanced accuracy;

  • Youden Youden�s J index;

  • Kappa Cohen's kappa;

  • AUC area under the ROC curve;

Examples


library(multiROC)

data(PlantGrowth)
roc_multi_analysis(PlantGrowth$weight, PlantGrowth$group)
#>   compared_groups feature cutoff TP FN FP TN sens spec  PPV  NPV  BAC Youden
#> 1   ctrl vs. trt1       1   4.41  5  5  1  9 0.50 0.90 0.83 0.64 0.70   0.40
#> 2   ctrl vs. trt2       1   5.26  8  2  3  7 0.80 0.70 0.73 0.78 0.75   0.50
#> 3   trt1 vs. trt2       1   4.92 10  0  2  8 1.00 0.80 0.83 1.00 0.90   0.80
#>   Kappa  AUC
#> 1  0.40 0.67
#> 2  0.50 0.75
#> 3  0.80 0.84

data(CO2)
roc_multi_analysis(CO2[, c("conc", "uptake")], CO2$Type)
#>          compared_groups feature cutoff TP FN FP TN sens spec  PPV  NPV  BAC
#> 1 Quebec vs. Mississippi    conc    250 18 24 18 24 0.43 0.57 0.50 0.50 0.50
#> 2 Quebec vs. Mississippi  uptake   32.4 41  1 13 29 0.98 0.69 0.76 0.97 0.83
#>   Youden Kappa  AUC
#> 1   0.00  0.00 0.50
#> 2   0.67  0.67 0.84

# --- For hyperSpec objects ---

library(hyperSpec)
fluorescence
#> hyperSpec object
#>    150 spectra
#>    3 data columns
#>    501 data points / spectrum
#> wavelength: lambda/nm [integer] 300 301 ... 800 
#> data:  (150 rows x 3 columns)
#>    1. gr:  [factor] B B ... A 
#>    2. class:  [factor] N l ... S1 
#>    3. spc: I / a.u. [matrix501] 159.8996 139.9296 ... 12.11558 
roc_multi_analysis(fluorescence[ , , 500~502], fluorescence$gr)
#> Error in nrow(DATA) %if_null% length(DATA): could not find function "%if_null%"
